text: 1. avoid significant adverse impacts on health and quality of life; 2. mitigate and minimise adverse impacts on health and quality of life; and 3. where possible, contribute to the improvement of health and quality of life. BACK TO CONTENTS Approaches to managing noise 1. Good design – Ensuring developments incorporate the concept of “good acoustic design” [1], including through minimising the number of sensitive receptors exposed to noise; ensuring adequate distances between the noise source and sensitive receptors or areas, limiting conflict of use in the development both internally and externally; utilising where possible barriers, natural or otherwise, other buildings, or non-critical rooms in a building. 2. Engineering – reducing noise at source; improving the sound insulation internally and externally of exposed receptors; screening by purpose-built barriers.
